SEARCH
Package com.example.lotteryevent.viewmodels

Class NotificationsViewModel

java.lang.Object
androidx.lifecycle.ViewModel
com.example.lotteryevent.viewmodels.NotificationsViewModel
public class NotificationsViewModel extends androidx.lifecycle.ViewModel
ViewModel for the NotificationsFragment. This class is responsible for managing the data and business logic related to notifications. It communicates with the INotificationRepository to fetch and update data, and it exposes this data to the UI via LiveData. It also handles the lifecycle of the real-time data listener.

    • getNavigateToEventDetails

      public androidx.lifecycle.LiveData<String> getNavigateToEventDetails()
      Exposes the navigation event as a LiveData object. The Fragment will observe this to know when to navigate to the EventDetailsFragment.

    • onNotificationClicked

      public void onNotificationClicked(Notification notification)
      This method contains the logic from the original fragment's `redirectOnNotificationClick`. It marks the notification as seen and triggers navigation if necessary.
      Parameters:
      notification - The notification that the user clicked on in the RecyclerView.

    • processInitialNotification

      public void processInitialNotification(String notificationId)
      Handles the initial state of the fragment, specifically if it was opened by a tap on a system notification from the status bar.
      Parameters:
      notificationId - The ID of the notification, passed via fragment arguments.

    • onNavigationComplete

      public void onNavigationComplete()
      The Fragment must call this method after it has successfully navigated. This prevents the navigation from being re-triggered on screen rotation.

    • onCleared

      protected void onCleared()
      This method is called by the Android framework when the ViewModel is about to be destroyed.
      Overrides:
      onCleared in class androidx.lifecycle.ViewModel
